A company buys 100 lightbulbs, each of which has an exponential lifetime of
1000 hours. What is the expected time for the first of these bulbs to burn
out? (See Exercise 10.)

![](/Users/cwong79/Dropbox/Public/CUNY/DATA 605/Discussion 8.png)

Assume that X1 and X2 are independent random variables, each having an
exponential density with parameter . Show that Z = X1 − X2 has density
fZ(z) = (1/2)e−|z| .

![](/Users/cwong79/Dropbox/Public/CUNY/DATA 605/Assign8-2.png)

Let X be a continuous random variable with mean μ = 10 and variance
2 = 100/3. Using Chebyshev’s Inequality, find an upper bound for the
following probabilities.

(a) P(|X − 10| >= 2).
